abstract: With the recent financial crisis some wonder whether the Securities and Exchange Commission has given in to the push to lighten up on regulation.
snippet: With the recent financial crisis some wonder whether the Securities and Exchange Commission has given in to the push to lighten up on regulation.
lead_paragraph: Not long ago the market police at the Securities and Exchange Commission gave JPMorgan Chase the Wall Street equivalent of a traffic ticket. The penalty: $25 million.

headline.main: Fears That the Market Watchdog Is Losing Its Bite
headline.print_headline: A Fear That the Market’s Watchdog Is Losing Its Bite

lead_paragraph: Not long ago the market police at the Securities and Exchange Commission gave JPMorgan Chase the Wall Street equivalent of a traffic ticket. The penalty: $25 million.

headline.main: A Fear That the Market’s Watchdog Is Losing Its Bite

abstract: The job market looks bleak for Bear Stearns employees swamping Wall Street with their résumés as the larger rival JPMorgan Chase acquires the firm, investment bankers and recruiters said.
lead_paragraph: The job market looks bleak for Bear Stearns employees swamping Wall Street with their résumés as the larger rival JPMorgan Chase acquires the firm, investment bankers and recruiters said.

headline.main: Bleak Times for Job-Hunting Bear Bankers

abstract: Yet another big name has emerged as a skeptic of the deal to sell Bear Stearns to JPMorgan Chase — and it’s a former predecessor to Ben Bernanke.
lead_paragraph: Yet another big name has emerged as a skeptic of the deal to sell Bear Stearns to JPMorgan Chase — and it’s a former predecessor to Ben Bernanke.

headline.main: Volcker Questions Fed’s Role in Bear Deal
